result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Discovery letter filed by Atty Crooks- Mishacoff to Atty Borsheim

9:07AM Defendant Robert T. Doucette appeared by video from the Columbia County jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Robert T. Doucette.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Borsheim updated the court on status of case and requested modification to bond, court amends bond to $500.00 cash bond, all previous conditions remain 9:17 AM
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Allison Borsheim
Scheduling Order

Plea date on September 14, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on September 28, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:07 AM Defendant Robert T. Doucette in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Robert T. Doucette.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. This will be set for a 1 day trial. 9:09 AM
Copy of discovery letter to Atty Allison Borsheim  from ADA Peggy Crooks Mishacoff
Arraignment 9-2-22 at 9:00 AM

2:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert T. Doucette in court in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Robert T. Doucette. State called witness Deputy J. Jones-Reigel of Columbia County Sheriff's Office. Direct exam by ADA Crooks-Mishacoff. Cross exam by Atty Borsheim. Redirect. No re cross. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court found probable cause, bound the defendant over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Appointed Attorney Allison Borsheim
Pretrial 7/5/22 at 2:30 PM and Return date 7-22-22 at 10:00 AM

Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. No acts/threats of violence towards any Columbia Count law enforcement or jail staff. Standard felony conditions. May return to IL to reside may not leave IL except for court.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert T. Doucette appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Robert T. Doucette. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $1000.00 cash bond. Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. No acts/threats of violence towards any Columbia Count law enforcement or jail staff. Standard felony conditions. May return to IL to reside may not leave IL except for court. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:27 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Return date scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
